about.description:
Faiss is a library for efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors.
It contains algorithms that search in sets of vectors of any size, up to ones that
possibly do not fit in RAM. It also contains supporting code for evaluation and
parameter tuning. Faiss is written in C++ with complete wrappers for Python/numpy.
Some of the most useful algorithms are implemented on the GPU. It is developed by
[Facebook AI Research](https://research.fb.com/category/facebook-ai-research-fair/).

For best performance, the maintainers of the package
[recommend](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/11337#issuecomment-623718460)
using the MKL implementation of blas/lapack. You can ensure that this is installed
by adding "libblas =*=*mkl" to your dependencies.
about.summary: A library for efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors.

name: libfaiss-avx2
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.4
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: libfaiss-avx2
  version: 1.7.0
source:
  patches:
    - patches/0002-Add-missing-headers-in-faiss-gpu-CMakeLists.txt-1666.patch
    - patches/0003-update-util-guard-for-compute_86.patch
    - patches/0004-Add-missing-includes-for-std-min-std-max.patch
    - patches/0005-make-AVX2-detection-platform-independent-1600.patch
    - patches/0006-make-setup.py-win-avx2-compatible-1682.patch
    - patches/0007-log-success-messages-and-errors-in-loader.py-1683.patch
    - patches/0008-add-msvc-compatible-AVX2-switch-in-CMakeLists.txt-16.patch
    - patches/0009-Win-AVX2-compat-1681.patch
    - patches/0010-Windows-portable-intrinsics-1684.patch
    - patches/0011-Fix-swig-vs.-AVX2-1717.patch
    - patches/0012-Small-fixes-for-compilation-on-ARM-1655.patch
    - patches/0013-roll-up-of-fixes-in-1737-1738-1739.patch
    - patches/0014-Portable-SWIG-Vectors-1742.patch
    - patches/0015-adapt-header-target-directory-to-outputname.patch
    - patches/0016-skip-test_stress-for-GPU-on-windows.patch
  sha256: f86d346ac9f409ee30abe37e52f6cce366b7f60d3924d65719f40aa07ceb4bec
  url: https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss/archive/v1.7.0.tar.gz
build:
  number: 7
  run_exports:
    - libfaiss_avx2 =*=*_cpu
    - libfaiss{{ libext }}
  string: h1234567_7_cpu
requirements:
  build:
    - bzip2 1.0.8 hc929b4f_4
    - c-ares 1.17.1 h0d85af4_1
    - ca-certificates 2020.12.5 h033912b_0
    - cctools_osx-64 949.0.1 h6407bdd_21
    - clang 10.0.1 default_hf57f61e_1
    - clang_osx-64 10.0.1 h05bbb7f_10
    - clangxx 10.0.1 default_hf57f61e_1
    - clangxx_osx-64 10.0.1 h05bbb7f_10
    - cmake 3.20.1 h32a7a09_0
    - compiler-rt 10.0.1 he6db49b_0
    - compiler-rt_osx-64 10.0.1 h033240e_0
    - expat 2.3.0 he49afe7_0
    - krb5 1.17.2 h60d9502_0
    - ld64_osx-64 530 hea264c1_17
    - ldid 2.1.2 h7660a38_2
    - libclang-cpp10 10.0.1 default_hf57f61e_1
    - libcurl 7.76.0 h8ef9fac_0
    - libcxx 11.1.0 habf9029_0
    - libedit 3.1.20191231 h0678c8f_2
    - libev 4.33 haf1e3a3_1
    - libllvm10 10.0.1 h009f743_3
    - libllvm11 11.1.0 hd011deb_2
    - libnghttp2 1.43.0 h07e645a_0
    - libssh2 1.9.0 h52ee1ee_6
    - libuv 1.41.0 hbcf498f_0
    - llvm-openmp 11.1.0 hda6cdc1_1
    - llvm-tools 10.0.1 h1341992_3
    - lz4-c 1.9.3 h046ec9c_0
    - ncurses 6.2 h2e338ed_4
    - openssl 1.1.1k h0d85af4_0
    - rhash 1.4.1 h35c211d_0
    - tapi 1100.0.11 h9ce4665_0
    - tk 8.6.10 h0419947_1
    - xz 5.2.5 haf1e3a3_1
    - zlib 1.2.11 h7795811_1010
    - zstd 1.4.9 h582d3a0_0
  host:
    - libblas 3.8.0 11_h508aa58_netlib
    - libcxx 11.1.0 habf9029_0
    - libgfortran 5.0.0 9_3_0_h6c81a4c_22
    - libgfortran5 9.3.0 h6c81a4c_22
    - liblapack 3.8.0 11_h508aa58_netlib
    - llvm-openmp 11.1.0 hda6cdc1_1
  run:
    - libblas >=3.8.0,<4.0a0
    - libcxx >=10.0.1
    - liblapack >=3.8.0,<4.0a0
    - llvm-openmp >=11.1.0
  run_constrained:
    - faiss-gpu ==9999999999
    - faiss-proc =*=cpu
test:
  commands:
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libfaiss_avx2.dylib
    - test ! -f $PREFIX/lib/libfaiss_avx2.a
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/AutoTune.h || (echo "AutoTune.h not found"
      && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/Clustering.h || (echo "Clustering.h not found"
      && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IVFlib.h || (echo "IVFlib.h not found" &&
      exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/Index.h || (echo "Index.h not found" && exit
      1)

      found" && exit 1)

      not found" && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IndexBinaryFromFloat.h || (echo "IndexBinaryFromFloat.h
      not found" && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IndexBinaryHNSW.h || (echo "IndexBinaryHNSW.h

      not found" && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IndexBinaryIVF.h || (echo "IndexBinaryIVF.h

    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IndexFlat.h || (echo "IndexFlat.h not found"

      && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IndexIVF.h || (echo "IndexIVF.h not found"

    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IndexPreTransform.h || (echo "IndexPreTransform.h

    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/IndexRefine.h || (echo "IndexRefine.h not

      && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/utils/WorkerThread.h || (echo "utils/WorkerThread.h
      not found" && exit 1)
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/utils/distances.h || (echo "utils/distances.h

    - test -f $PREFIX/include/faiss_avx2/utils/ordered_key_value.h || (echo "utils/ordered_key_value.h

about:
  description: 'Faiss is a library for efficient similarity search and clustering
    of dense vectors.

    It contains algorithms that search in sets of vectors of any size, up to ones
    that

    possibly do not fit in RAM. It also contains supporting code for evaluation and

    parameter tuning. Faiss is written in C++ with complete wrappers for Python/numpy.

    Some of the most useful algorithms are implemented on the GPU. It is developed
    by

    [Facebook AI Research](https://research.fb.com/category/facebook-ai-research-fair/).


    For best performance, the maintainers of the package

    [recommend](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/11337#issuecomment-623718460)

    using the MKL implementation of blas/lapack. You can ensure that this is installed

    by adding "libblas =*=*mkl" to your dependencies.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss
  doc_url: https://rawgit.com/facebookresearch/faiss/master/docs/html/annotated.html
  home: https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: A library for efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors.
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - h-vetinari

about.description:
Faiss is a library for efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors.
It contains algorithms that search in sets of vectors of any size, up to ones that
possibly do not fit in RAM. It also contains supporting code for evaluation and
parameter tuning. Faiss is written in C++ with complete wrappers for Python/numpy.
Some of the most useful algorithms are implemented on the GPU. It is developed by
[Facebook AI Research](https://research.fb.com/category/facebook-ai-research-fair/).

For best performance, the maintainers of the package
[recommend](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/11337#issuecomment-623718460)
using the MKL implementation of blas/lapack. You can ensure that this is installed
by adding "libblas =*=*mkl" to your dependencies.
about.summary: A library for efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors.
